data.quote: They are proud in humility  proud in that they are not proud.
data.author: Henry Burton

data.quote: Pride ruined the angels.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Pride that dines on vanity  sups on contempt.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: The proud hate pride - in others.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: Oh! Why should the spirit of mortal be proud? Like a swift-fleeing meteor  a fast flying cloud  A flash of the lightning  a break of the wave  Man passes from life to his rest in the grave.
data.author: William Knox

data.quote: Pride and weakness are Siamese twins.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: Pride goeth before destruction  and an haughty spirit before a fall.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: In pride  in reas'ning pride  our error lies  All quit their sphere and rush into the skies. Pride still is aiming at the bless'd abodes  Men would be angels  angels would be gods.
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.quote: The infinitely little have pride infinitely great.
data.author: Voltaire

data.quote: Principles become modified in practise by facts.
data.author: James Fenimore Cooper

data.quote: If principle is good for anything  it is worth living up to.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: Important principles may and must be flexible.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: Stone walls do not a prison make  Nor iron bars a cage  Minds innocent and quiet take That for an hermitage.
data.author: Richard Lovelace

data.quote: In durance vile here must I wake and weep  And all my frowsy couch in sorrow steep.
data.author: James Drummond Burns

data.quote: While we have prisons it matters little which of us occupy the cells.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: Under a government which imprisons any unjustly  the true place for a just man is also a prison.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: I know not whether laws be right  Or whether laws be wrong  All that we know who lie in gaol Is that the wall is strong  And that each day is like a year  A year whose days are long.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: None of us can be free of conflict and woe. Even the greatest men have had to accept disappointments as their daily bread.
data.author: Bernard M. Baruch

data.quote: There is no man in any rank who is always at liberty to act as he would incline. In some quarter or other he is limited by circumstances.
data.author: Bonnie Blair

data.quote: Life has no smooth road for any of us  and in the bracing atmosphere of a high aim the very roughness stimulates the climber to steadier steps till the legend  "over steep ways to the stars " fulfills itself.

data.quote: When life's problems seem overwhelming  look around and see what other people are coping with. You may consider yourself fortunate.
data.author: Ann Landers

data.quote: If all our misfortunes were laid in one common heap  whence everyone must take an equal portion  most people would be content to take their own and depart.
data.author: Socrates

data.quote: A problem well stated is a problem half solved.

data.quote: It isn't that they can't see the solution  it's that they can't see the problem.
data.author: G. K. Chesterton

data.quote: If we can really understand the problem  the answer will come out of it  because the answer is not separate from the problem.

data.quote: The man who most vividly realizes a difficulty is the man most likely to overcome it.

data.quote: A good problem statement often includes: (a) what is known  (b) what is unknown  and (c) what is sought.

data.quote: Every path has its puddle.

data.quote: You often get a better hold upon a problem by going away from it for a time and dismissing it from your mind altogether.

data.quote: What one decides to do in crisis depends on one's philosophy of life  and that philosophy cannot be changed by an incident. If one hasn't any philosophy in crises  others make the decision.

data.quote: When I feel difficulty coming on  I switch to another book I'm writing. When I get back to the problem  my unconscious has solved it.
data.author: Isaac Asimov

data.quote: You can surmount the obstacles in your path if you are determined  courageous and hard-working. Never be fainthearted. Be resolute  but never bitter.... Permit no one to dissuade you from pursuing the goals you set for yourselves. Do not fear to pioneer  to venture down new paths of endeavor.
data.author: Ralph J. Bunche

data.quote: Any concern too small to be turned into a prayer is too small to be made into a burden.
data.author: Corrie ten Boom

data.quote: When you approach a problem  strip yourself of preconceived opinions and prejudice  assemble and learn the facts of the situation  make the decision which seems to you to be the most honest  and then stick to it.
data.author: Chester Bowles

data.quote: The art of living lies less in eliminating our troubles than in growing with them.
data.author: Bernard M. Baruch

data.quote: No matter how big and tough a problem may be  get rid of confusion by taking one little step towards solution. Do something. Then try again. At the worst  so long as you don't do it the same way twice  you will eventually use up all the wrong ways of doing it and thus the next try will be the right one.
data.author: George F. Nordenholt

data.quote: The greatest and most important problems of life are all in a certain sense insoluble. They can never be solved  but only outgrown.
data.author: Carl Jung

data.quote: You can overcome anything if you don't bellyache.

data.quote: There is no other solution to a man's problems but the day's honest work  the day's honest decisions  the day's generous utterance  and the day's good deed.

data.quote: Every problem contains the seeds of its own solution.

data.quote: When you can't solve the problem  manage it.

data.quote: The block of granite  which was an obstacle in the path of the weak  becomes a stepping stone in the path of the strong.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: Real difficulties can be overcome  it is only the imaginary ones that are unconquerable.
data.author: Theodore N. Vail

data.quote: Many a man curses the rain that falls upon his head  and knows not that it brings abundance to drive away hunger.

data.quote: Times of general calamity and confusion have ever been productive of the greatest minds. The purest ore is produced from the hottest furnace  and the brightest thunderbolt is elicited from the darkest storms.
data.author: Charles Caleb Colton

data.quote: What is difficulty? Only a word indicating the degree of strength requisite for accomplishing particular objects  a mere notice of the necessity for exertion ... a mere stimulus to men.
data.author: Samuel Warren

data.quote: Problems are only opportunities in work clothes.

data.quote: We must look for the opportunity in every difficulty  instead of being paralyzed at the thought of the difficulty in every opportunity.
data.author: Walter E. Cole

data.quote: I wish I were with some of the wild people that run in the woods  and know nothing about accomplishments!
data.author: Joanna Baillie

data.quote: I used to believe that marriage would diminish me  reduce my options. That you had to be someone less to live with someone else when  of course  you have to be someone more.
data.author: Candice Bergen

data.quote: The human mind prefers to be spoonfed with the thoughts of others  but deprived of such nourishment it will  reluctantly  begin to think for itself- and such thinking  remember  is original thinking and may have valuable results.
data.author: Agatha Christie

data.quote: I'll have to  as you say  take a stand  do something toward shaking up that system. ... Despair ... is too easy an out.
data.author: Paule Marshall

data.quote: Half the unhappiness in life comes from people being afraid to go straight at things.
data.author: William J. Lock

data.quote: All work of man is as the swimmer's: a vast ocean threatens to devour him  if he front it not bravely  it will keep its word.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: Hiding leads nowhere except to more hiding.
data.author: Margaret A. Robinson

data.quote: There is no movement without our own resistance.
data.author: Dr. Laura Schlessinger

data.quote: All problems become smaller if you don't dodge them  but confront them.
data.author: William F. Halsey

data.quote: The best way out of a problem is through it.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: A great man is one who seizes the vital issue in a complex question  what we might call the jugular vein of the whole organism  and spends his energies upon that.

data.quote: Fear not those who argue but those who dodge.
data.author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

data.quote: If the first woman God ever made was strong enough to turn the world upside down  these women together ought to be able to turn it right side up again.
data.author: Sojourner Truth

data.quote: It is a fact of history that those who seek to withdraw from its great experiments usually end up being overwhelmed by them.

data.quote: Only one feat is possible: not to have run away.
data.author: Dag Hammarskjold

data.quote: We must prepare and study truth under every aspect  endeavoring to ignore nothing  if we do not wish to fall into the abyss of the unknown when the hour shall strike.
data.author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

data.quote: We only really face up to ourselves when we are afraid.
data.author: Thomas Bernhard

data.quote: Life is the acceptance of responsibilities or their evasion  it is a business of meeting obligations or avoiding them. To every man the choice is continually being offered  and by the manner of his choosing you may fairly measure him.

data.quote: No man will succeed unless he is ready to face and overcome difficulties and is prepared to assume responsibilities.

data.quote: The harder the conflict  the more glorious the triumph. What we obtain too cheap  we esteem too lightly  'tis dearness only that gives everything it's value.

data.quote: Life affords no higher pleasure than that of surmounting difficulties.

data.author: Henri Frederic Amiel

data.quote: We cannot all be masters.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: To do all that one is able to do is to be a man  to do all that one would like to do is to be a god.
data.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

data.quote: No one is expected to achieve the impossible.
data.author: French proverb

data.quote: A hero is a man who does what he can.
data.author: Romain Rolland

data.quote: It is only fools who keep straining at high C all their lives.
data.author: Charles Dudley Warner

data.quote: May God ... let me strive for attainable things.
data.author: Pindar

data.quote: Despair is the price one pays for setting himself an impossible aim.
data.author: Graham Greene

data.quote: We would have to settle for the elegant goal of becoming ourselves.
data.author: William Styron

data.quote: A great obstacle to happiness is to expect too much happiness.
data.author: Bernard de Fontenelle

data.quote: There is a proper balance between not asking enough of oneself and asking or expecting too much.
data.author: May Sarton

data.quote: I hope to work  support my children and die quietly without pain.
data.author: Sean Connery

data.quote: As we advance in life  we learn the limits of our abilities.
data.author: J. A. Froude

data.quote: Striving for excellence motivates you  striving for perfection is demoralizing.
data.author: Dr. Harriet Braiker

data.quote: It is enough that I am of value to somebody today.
data.author: Hugh Prather

data.quote: A tomb now suffices him for whom the whole world was not sufficient.
data.author: Alexander the Great

data.quote: To wish to act like angels while we are still in this world is nothing but folly.
data.author: Teresa of Avila

data.quote: It isn't important to come out on top  what matters is to be the one who comes out alive.
data.author: Bertolt Brecht

data.quote: I long to accomplish a great and noble task  but it is my chief duty to accomplish small tasks as if they were great and noble.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: I cannot do everything  but still I can do something  and because I cannot do everything  I will not refuse to do something I can do.
data.author: Edward Everett Hale

data.quote: Do not lose courage in considering your own imperfections.
data.author: Saint Francis de Sales

data.quote: Happy the man who early learns the wide chasm that lies between his wishes and his powers.
data.author: Johann von Goethe

data.quote: [Being a parent] is tough. If you just want a wonderful little creature to love  you can get a puppy.
data.author: Barbara Walters

data.quote: You never conquer a mountain. You stand on the summit a few moments  then the wind blows your footprints away.
data.author: Arlene Blum

data.quote: If we are to survive on this planet  there must be compromises.
data.author: Storm Jameson

data.quote: Real life is  to most men ... a perpetual compromise between the ideal and the possible.
data.author: Bertrand Russell

data.quote: He who cannot do what he wants must make do with what he can.
data.author: Terence

data.quote: What has always made a hell on earth has been that man has tried to make it his heaven.
data.author: Friedrich Holderlin

data.quote: Good is not good  where better is expected.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: Nobody has things just as he would like them. The thing to do is to make a success with what material I have. It is a sheer waste of time and soul-power to imagine what I would do if things were different. They are not different.
data.author: Dr. Frank Crane

data.quote: People are lucky and unlucky ... according to the ratio between what they get and what they have been led to expect.
data.author: Samuel Butler

data.quote: We must like what we have when we don't have what we like.
data.author: Roger de Rabutin

data.quote: Better is the enemy of the good.
data.author: Voltaire

data.quote: If you aspire to the highest place  it is no disgrace to stop at the second  or even the third  place.
data.author: Cicero

data.quote: Genius does what it must  talent does what it can.
data.author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

data.quote: A hero is a man who does what he can.
data.author: Romain Rolland

data.quote: Nature is what you may do. There is much you may not do.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Results are what you expect  consequences are what you get.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The resistance to the unpleasant situation is the root of suffering.
data.author: Ram Dass

data.quote: To expect life to be tailored to our specifications is to invite frustration.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Each of us does  in effect  strike a series of "deals " or compromises  between the wants and longings of the inner self  and an outer environment that offers certain possibilities and sets certain limitations.
data.author: Maggie Scarf

data.quote: Man is the only animal that laughs and weeps  for he is the only animal that is struck with the difference between what things are  and what they might have been.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: We do not write as we want  but as we can.
data.author: W. Somerset Maugham

data.quote: Every creator painfully experiences the chasm between his inner vision and its ultimate expression. The chasm is never completely bridged. We all have the conviction  perhaps illusory  that we have much more to say than appears on the paper.
data.author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

data.quote: A body shouldn't heed what might be. He's got to do with what is.
data.author: Louis L'Amour

data.quote: The chief pang of most trials is not so much the actual suffering itself as our own spirit of resistance to it.
data.author: Jean Nicholas Grou

data.quote: The greatest and most important problems in life are all in a certain sense insoluble. They can never be solved  but only outgrown.
data.author: Carl Jung

data.quote: The art of living lies less in eliminating our troubles than in growing with them.
data.author: Bernard M. Baruch

data.quote: Life has not taught me to expect nothing  but she has taught me not to expect success to be the inevitable result of my endeavors.
data.author: Alan Paton

data.quote: Knowledge of what is possible is the beginning of happiness.
data.author: George Santayana

data.quote: Don't spend time beating on a wall  hoping to transform it into a door.
data.author: Dr. Laura Schlessinger

data.quote: If I were to wish for anything  I should not wish for wealth and power  but for the passionate sense of the potential  for the eye which  ever young and ardent  sees the possible ... what wine is so sparkling  so fragrant  so intoxicating  as possibility!
data.author: Soren Kierkegaard

data.quote: Wisdom never kicks at the iron walls it can't bring down.
data.author: Olive Schreiner

data.quote: It is impossible to control creation.
data.author: Evelyn Scott

data.quote: To seek fulfillment is to invite frustration.
data.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

data.quote: Half the unhappiness in the world is due to the failure of plans which were never reasonable  and often impossible.
data.author: Edgar Watson Howe

data.quote: There is an illusion that has much to do with ... most of our unhappiness. ... We expect too much.
data.author: Joseph Farrell

data.quote: A fool or idiot is one who expects things to happen that never can happen.
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: Shall a man go and hang himself because he belongs to the race of pygmies  and not be the biggest pygmy that he can?
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: Life is a compromise of what your ego wants to do  what experience tells you to do  and what your nerves let you do.
data.author: Bruce Crampton

data.quote: No  Doctor  I don't want to grow young again. I just want to keep on growing old.
data.author: Madame de Rothschild

data.quote: What we call reality is an agreement that people have arrived at to make life more livable.
data.author: Louise Nevelson

data.quote: There is no such thing as pure pleasure  some anxiety always goes with it.
data.author: Ovid

data.quote: When somebody tells you nothing is impossible  ask him to dribble a football.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: No country can act wisely simultaneously in every part of the globe at every moment of time.
data.author: Henry Kissinger

data.quote: The most important thing in marriage is not happiness  but stability.
data.author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

data.quote: So often we search out the impossible  and then throw ourselves into trying to do it.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Nothing is so good as it seems beforehand.
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: Prospect is often better than possession.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: The hours we pass with happy prospects in view are more pleasing than those crowned with fruition.
data.author: Oliver Goldsmith

data.quote: 'Tis expectation makes a blessing dear  heaven were not heaven if we knew what it were.
data.author: Sir John Sucking

data.quote: Life is so constructed that the event does not  cannot  will not  match the expectation.
data.author: Charlotte Bronte

data.quote: There is no greater enemy to those who would please than expectation.
data.author: Michel de Montaigne

data.quote: To dream too much of the person you would like to be is to waste the person you are.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Too many people miss the silver lining because they're expecting gold.
data.author: Maurice Setter

data.quote: For people who live on expectations  to face up to their realization is something of an ordeal.
data.author: Elizabeth Bowen

data.quote: My expectations-which I extended whenever I came close to accomplishing my goals-made it impossible ever to feel satisfied with my success.
data.author: Ellen Sue Stern

data.quote: Every attempt to make war easy and safe will result in humiliation and disaster.
data.author: General William Sherman

data.quote: I sincerely wish war was a pleasanter and easier business than it is  but it does not admit of holidays.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: There is many a boy here today who looks on war as all glory  but boys  it is all hell.
data.author: General William T. Sherman

data.quote: War is not an adventure. It is a disease. It is like typhus.
data.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

data.quote: In combat  life is short  nasty and brutish. The issues of national policy which brought him into war are irrelevant to the combat soldier  he is concerned with his literal life chances.
data.author: Charles E. Moskos

data.quote: In war  more than anywhere else in the world  things happen differently from what we had expected  and look differently when near from what they did at a distance.
data.author: Karl von Clausewitz

data.quote: In spite of all of the training you get and the precautions you take to keep yourself alive  it's largely a matter of luck that decides whether or not you get killed.
data.author: James Jones

data.quote: Moderation in war is imbecility.
data.author: Admiral John Fisher

data.quote: When one's expectations are reduced to zero  one really appreciates everything one does have.
data.author: Stephen Hawking

data.quote: I like trees because they seem more resigned to the way they have to live than other things do.
data.author: Willa Cather

data.quote: Life didn't promise to be wonderful.
data.author: Teddy Pendergrass

data.quote: We never enjoy perfect happiness  our most fortunate successes are mingled with sadness  some anxieties always perplex the reality of our satisfaction.
data.author: Pierre Corneille

data.quote: Do not commit the error  common among the young  of assuming that if you cannot save the whole of mankind you have failed.
data.author: Jan de Hartog

data.quote: The art of living lies less in eliminating our troubles than in growing with them.
data.author: Bernard M. Baruch

data.quote: If one considered life as a simple loan  one would perhaps be less exacting.
data.author: Eugene Delacroix

data.quote: Why are we surprised when fig trees bear figs?
data.author: Margaret Titzel

data.quote: Those who aim at great deeds must also suffer greatly.
data.author: Plutarch

data.quote: I have nothing to offer but blood  toil  tears  and sweat.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: There's no map  there's no master plan  there's just people.
data.author: Stingray

data.quote: Every writer I know has trouble writing.
data.author: Joseph Heller

data.quote: Men expect too much  do too little.
data.author: Allen Tate

data.quote: Human kind cannot bear very much reality.
data.author: T. S. Eliot

data.quote: If anything is poisoning our lives and weakening our society  it is reality - and not the fabrication of television writers and producers.
data.author: Martin Moloney

data.quote: There is no reality except the one contained within us. That is why so many people live such an unreal life. They take the images outside them for reality and never allow the world within to assert itself.
data.author: Hermann Hesse

data.quote: Nothing which is at all times and in every way agreeable to us can have objective reality. It is of the very nature of the real that it should have sharp corners and rough edges  that it should be resistant  should be itself. Dream-furniture is the only kind on which you never stub your toes or bang your knee.
data.author: C. S. Lewis

data.quote: Facts as facts do not always create a spirit of reality  because reality is a spirit.
data.author: G. K. Chesterton

data.quote: We take our shape  it is true  within and against that cage of reality bequeathed us at our birth  and yet it is precisely through our dependence on this reality that we are most endlessly betrayed.
data.author: James Baldwin

data.quote: You too must not count overmuch on your reality as you feel it today  since  like that of yesterday  it may prove an illusion for you tomorrow.
data.author: Luigi Pirandello

data.quote: All our interior world is reality - and that perhaps more so than our apparent world.
data.author: Marc Chagall

data.quote: The field of consciousness is tiny. It accepts only one problem at a time. Get into a fist fight  put your mind on the strategy of the fight  and you will not feel the other fellow's punches.
data.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

data.quote: A life based on reason will always require to be balanced by an occasional bout of violent and irrational emotion  for the instinctual tribes must be satisfied.
data.author: Cyril Connolly

data.quote: Analysis kills spontaneity. The grain once ground into flour springs and germinates no more.
data.author: Henri Frederic Amiel

data.quote: Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored.
data.author: Aldous Huxley

data.quote: I like reality. It tastes of bread.
data.author: Jean Anouilh

data.quote: The time is comin' whin not more thin hath iv us'll be rale  an' th' rest'll be rubber  (plastic!)
data.author: Finley Peter Dunne

data.quote: To see what is in front of one's nose needs a constant struggle.
data.author: George Orwell

data.quote: We do not fight for the real but for shadows we make A flag is a piece of cloth and a word is a sound  But we make them something neither cloth nor a sound Tokens of love and hate  black sorcery stones.
data.author: Stephen Vincent Benet

data.quote: Where I cannot satisfy my reason  I love to humour my fancy.
data.author: Sir Thomas Browne

data.quote: When the human mind exists in the light of reason and no more than reason  we may say with absolute certainty that Man and all that made him will be in that instant gone.
data.author: Loren Eiseley

data.quote: I have hardly ever known a mathematician who was capable of reasoning.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: Reason is God's gift  but so are the passions. Reason is as guilty as passion.
data.author: Cardinal Newman

data.quote: The man who is master of his passions is Reason's slave.
data.author: Cyril Connolly

data.quote: Human reason needs only to will more strongly than fate  and she is fate.
data.author: Thomas Mann

data.quote: Reason deserves to be called a prophet  for in showing up the consequence and effect of our actions in the present  does it not tell us what the future will be?
data.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

data.quote: The difference between the reason of man and the instinct of the beast is this  that the beast does but know  but the man knows that he knows.
data.author: John Donne

data.quote: Reason is also choice.
data.author: John Milton

data.quote: Reason is an emotion for the sexless.
data.author: Heathcote Williams

data.quote: The last advance of reason is to recognize that it is surpassed by innumerable things  it is feeble if it cannot realize that.
data.author: Blaise Pascal

data.quote: All our reasoning ends in surrender to feeling.
data.author: Blaise Pascal

data.quote: Reason is the mistress and queen of all things.
data.author: Cicero

data.quote: He who will not reason  is a bigot  he who cannot is a fool  and he who dares not  is a slave.
data.author: William Drummond

data.quote: Reason can in general do more than blind force.
data.author: Gallus

data.quote: If I go to heaven I want to take my reason with me.
data.author: Charles J. Ingersoll

data.quote: Come now  and let us reason together.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Error of opinion may be tolerated where reason is left free to combat it.
data.author: Thomas Jefferson

data.quote: Human reason is like a drunken man on horseback  set it up on one side  and it tumbles over on the other.
data.author: Martin Luther

data.quote: You know  my friends  with what a brave carouse I made a second marriage in my house  Divorced old barren reason from my bed  And took the daughter of the vine to spouse.
data.author: Omar Khayyam

data.quote: The feast of reason and the flow of soul.
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.quote: Every why hath a wherefore.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: I have no other but a woman's reason. I think him so because I think him so.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Many are destined to reason wrongly  others  not to reason at all: and others to persecute those who do reason.
data.author: Voltaire

data.quote: There are so many people with all kinds of lucky things happening to them  and they don't know how to use it.
data.author: Rocky Aoki

data.quote: Probably any successful career has "X" number of breaks in it  and maybe the difference between successful people and those who aren't superachievers is taking advantage of those breaks.
data.author: Joan Ganz Cooney

data.quote: To get it right  be born with luck or else make it.
data.author: Ruth Gordon

data.quote: You must always be open to your luck. You cannot force it  but you can recognize it.
data.author: Henry Moore

data.quote: Genius is the gold in the mine  talent is the miner that works and brings it out.
data.author: Lady Marguerite Blessington

data.quote: It is one thing to be gifted and quite another thing to be worthy of one's own gift.
data.author: Nadia Boulanger

data.quote: Talent on its own sat gracefully only on the very young. After a certain age it was what you did with it that counted.
data.author: Liza Cody

data.quote: A wise man turns chance into good fortune.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: Luck ... taps  once in a lifetime  at everybody's door  but if industry does not open it  luck goes away.
data.author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon

data.quote: When something bad happens to me  I think I'm able to deal with it in a pretty good way. That makes me lucky. Some people fall apart at the first little thing that happens.
data.author: Christie Brinkley

data.quote: It's funny  but... you're sort of a moving target for fortune  and you never know when it will befall you.
data.author: Thomas McGuane

data.quote: Lady Luck generally woos those who earnestly  enthusiastically  unremittingly woo her.
data.author: B. C. Forbes

data.quote: Luck is good planning  carefully executed.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: What helps luck is a habit of watching for opportunities  of having a patient  but restless mind  of sacrificing one's ease or vanity  of uniting a love of detail to foresight  and of passing through hard times bravely and cheerfully.
data.author: Charles Victor Cherbuliez

data.quote: Luck is believing you're lucky.
data.author: Tennessee Williams

data.quote: I think that one can have luck if one tries to create an atmosphere of spontaneity.
data.author: Federico Fellini

data.quote: Each man's character shapes his fortunes.
data.author: Latin proverb

data.quote: Chance works for us when we are good captains.
data.author: George Meredith

data.quote: Motivation triggers luck.
data.author: Mike Wallace

data.quote: Good and bad luck is a synonym  in the great majority of instances  for good and bad judgment.
data.author: John Chatfield

data.quote: Luck is a combination of confidence and getting the breaks.
data.author: Christy Mathewson

data.quote: I was born lucky  and I have lived lucky. What I had was used. What I still have is being used. Lucky.
data.author: Katharine Hepburn

data.quote: Luck is largely a matter of paying attention.
data.author: Susan M. Dodd

data.quote: Your luck is how you treat people.
data.author: Bridget O'Donnell

data.quote: The only sure thing about luck is that it will change.
data.author: Bret Harte

data.quote: The man who glories in his luck may be overthrown by destiny.
data.author: Euripides

data.quote: There is in the worst of fortune the best of chances for a happy change.
data.author: Euripides

data.quote: It is more easy to get a favor from fortune than to keep it.
data.author: Publilius Syrus

data.quote: Since luck's a nine days' wonder  wait their end.
data.author: Euripides

data.quote: Fortune is with you for an hour  and against you for ten!
data.author: Arab proverb

data.quote: Breaks balance out. The sun don't shine on the same old dog's rear end every day.
data.author: Darrell Royal

data.quote: What the reason of the ant laboriously drags into a heap  the wind of accident will collect in one breath.
data.author: J. C. F. von Schiller

data.quote: Fortune is like the market  where many times  if you can stay a little  the price will fall.
data.author: Francis Bacon

data.quote: The profits of good luck are perishable  if you build on fortune  you build on sand  the more advancement you achieve  the more dangers you run.
data.author: Marquis de Racan

data.quote: Every possession and every happiness is but lent by chance for an uncertain time  and may therefore be demanded back the next hour.
data.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

data.quote: Life is full of chances and changes  and the most prosperous of men may ... meet with great misfortunes.
data.author: Aristotle

data.quote: Reforms should begin at home and stay there.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: At twenty a man is full of fight and hope. He wants to reform the world. When he's seventy he still wants to reform the world  but he knows he can't.
data.author: Clarence S. Darrow

data.quote: We are reformers in Spring and Summer  in Autumn and Winter we stand by the old  reformers in the morning  conservers at night.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Reform must come from within  not from without. You cannot legislate for virtue.
data.author: James Cardinal Gibbons

data.quote: The hole and the patch should be commensurate.
data.author: Thomas Jefferson

data.quote: To make a crooked stick straight  we bend it the contrary way.
data.author: Michel Montaigne

data.quote: An indefinable something is to be done  in a way nobody knows how  at a time nobody knows when  that will accomplish nobody knows what.
data.author: Thomas B. Read

data.quote: Very frequently  feminine activity also expresses itself in what is largely a retrospectively oriented pondering over what we ought to have done differently in life  and how we ought to have done it  or  as if under compulsion  we make up strings of causal connections. We like to call this thinking  though  on the contrary  it is a form of mental activity that is strangely pointless and unproductive  a form that really leads only to self-torture.
data.author: Emma Jung

data.quote: The only causes of regret are laziness  outbursts of temper  hurting others  prejudice  jealousy  and envy.
data.author: Germaine Greer

data.quote: If you have behaved badly  repent  make what amends you can and address yourself to the task of behaving better next time. On no account brood over your wrongdoing. Rolling in the muck is not the best way of getting clean.
data.author: Aldous Huxley

data.quote: You always feel when you look it straight in the eye that you could have put more into it  could have let yourself go and dug harder.
data.author: Emily Carr

data.quote: When one door closes another opens. But we often look so long and so regretfully upon the closed door that we fail to see the one that has opened for us.
data.author: Alexander Graham Bell

data.quote: No doing without some ruing.
data.author: Sigrid Undset

data.quote: Nobody gets to live life backward. Look ahead  that is where your future lies.
data.author: Ann Landers

data.quote: Were it not better to forget Than to remember and regret?
data.author: L. E. Landon

data.quote: Regret for the things we did can be tempered by time  it is regret for the things we did not do that is inconsolable.
data.author: Sydney J. Harris

data.quote: Always repenting of wrongs done will never bring my heart to rest.
data.author: Ji Kang

data.quote: Should-haves solve nothing. It's the next thing to happen that needs thinking about.
data.author: Alexandra Ripley

data.quote: The error of the past is the success of the future. A mistake is evidence that someone tried to do something.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Regret is an appalling waste of energy  you can't build on it  it is good only for wallowing.
data.author: Katherine Mansfield

data.quote: I have always found that each step we take in life is to be regretted-if we once begin to wonder how many other steps might have been possible.
data.author: John Oliver Hobbes

data.quote: If you cannot get rid of the family skeleton  you may as well make it dance.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: Let the dead Past bury its dead!
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: "The horror of that moment " the King went on  "I shall never forget." "You will  though " the Queen said  "if you don't make a memorandum of it."
data.author: Lewis Carroll

data.quote: Reflect upon your present blessings  of which every man has many-not on your past misfortunes  of which all men have some.
data.author: Charles Dickens

data.quote: They say you should not suffer through the past. You should be able to wear it like a loose garment  take it off and let it drop.
data.author: Eva Jessye

data.quote: Your past is always going to be the way it was. Stop trying to change it.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The only thing I regret about my past is the length of it. If I had to live my life again  I'd make the same mistakes  only sooner.
data.author: Tallulah Bankhead

data.quote: There is no greater sorrow than to recall a happy time in the midst of wretchedness.
data.author: Dante Alighieri

data.quote: We should have no regrets. ... The past is finished. There is nothing to be gained by going over it. Whatever it gave us in the experiences it brought us was something we had to know.
data.author: Rebecca Beard

data.quote: One must never lose time in vainly regretting the past or in complaining against the changes which cause us discomfort  for change is the essence of life.
data.author: Anatole France

data.quote: Yesterday's errors let yesterday cover.
data.author: Susan Coolidge

data.quote: This is another day! Are its eyes blurred with maudlin grief for any wasted past? A thousand thousand failures shall not daunt! Let dust clasp dust  death  death  I am alive!
data.author: Don Marquis

data.quote: Whatever with the past has gone  the best is always yet to come.
data.author: Lucy Larcom

data.quote: Hindsight is always zo/20.
data.author: Billy Wilder

data.quote: I respect only those who resist me  but cannot tolerate them.
data.author: Charles de Gaulle

data.quote: The easiest kind of relationship for me is with 10 000 people. The hardest is with one.
data.author: Joan Baez

data.quote: When the man is at home  his standing in society is well known and quietly taken  but when he is abroad  it is problematical  and is dependent on the success of his manners.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: We rarely confide in those who are better than we are.
data.author: Albert Camus

data.quote: With three or more people there is something bold in the air: direct things get said which would frighten two people alone and conscious of each inch of their nearness to one another. To be three is to be in public - you feel safe.
data.author: Elizabeth Bowen

data.quote: It is always safe to assume that people are more subtle and less sensitive than they seem.
data.author: Eric Hoffer

data.quote: The more you let yourself go  the less others let you go.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: At bottom the world isn't a joke. We only joke about it to avoid an issue with someone  to let someone know that we know he's there with his questions  to disarm him by seeming to have heard and done justice to his side of the standing argument.
data.author: Robert Frost

data.quote: Science may have found a cure for most evils: but it has found no remedy for the worst of them all - the apathy of human beings.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: It is well to remember that the entire population of the universe  with one trifling exception  is composed of others.
data.author: John Andrew Holmes

data.quote: Make yourself necessary to somebody.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: The opinions which we hold of one another  our relations with friends and kinsfolk are in no sense permanent  save in appearance  but are as eternally fluid as the sea itself.

data.quote: Mystic: a person who is puzzled before the obvious  but who understands the non-existent.

data.quote: Men will wrangle for religion  write for it  fight for it  die for it  anything but live for it.

data.quote: I have never yet met a healthy person who worries very much about his health or a really good person who worries much about his own soul.

data.quote: Men are idolaters  and want something to look at and kiss and hug  or throw themselves down before  they always did  they always will  and if you don't make it of wood  you must make it of words.

data.quote: The various modes of worship which prevailed in the Roman world were all considered by the people as equally true  by the philosopher as equally false  and by the magistrate as equally useful.

data.quote: Nothing in human life  least of all in religion  is ever right until it is beautiful.
data.author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

data.quote: I think if you ask people what their concept of heaven is  they would say  if they are honest  that it is a big department store  with new things every week - all the money to buy them  and maybe a little more than the neighbours.

data.quote: We have grasped the mystery of the atom  and rejected the Sermon on the Mount.
data.author: Omar Bradley

data.quote: Religion is a great force - the only real motive force in the world  but you must get at a man through his own religion  not through yours.

data.quote: It must require an inordinate share of vanity and presumption after enjoying so much that is good and beautiful on earth  to ask the Lord for immortality in addition to it all.
data.author: Heinrich Heine

data.quote: Oysters are more beautiful than any religion . . . there's nothing in Christianity or Buddhism that quite matches the sympathetic unselfishness of an oyster.
data.author: Saki

data.quote: Don't be agnostic - be something.
data.author: Robert Frost

data.quote: A gentle Quaker  hearing a strange noise in his house one night  got up and discovered a burglar busily at work. He went and got his gun  came back and stood quietly in the doorway. 'Friend ' he said  'I would do thee no harm for the world  but thou standest where I am about to shoot.'
data.author: James Hines

data.quote: We Jews have a secret weapon in our struggle with the Arabs - we have no place to go.
data.author: Golda Meir

data.quote: Religion is a way of walking  not a way of talking.

data.quote: Puritanism - the haunting fear that someone  somewhere may be happy.
data.author: H. L. Mencken

data.quote: The worst moment for the atheist is when he is really thankful  and has nobody to thank.
data.author: Dante Gabriel Rossetti

data.quote: The mystery of the beginning of all things is insoluble by us  and I for one must be content to remain agnostic.
data.author: Charles Darwin

data.quote: Religion converts despair  which destroys  into resignation  which submits.

data.quote: For the wonderful thing about saints is that they were human. They lost their tempers  got angry  scolded God  were egotistical or testy or impatient in their turns  made mistakes and regretted them. Still they went on doggedly blundering toward heaven.

data.quote: Audible at five miles  painful at three  and lethal at one.

data.quote: With soap baptism is a good thing.

data.quote: The Church of England is the Tory party at prayer.

data.quote: A Unitarian very earnestly disbelieves what everyone else believes.
data.author: W. Somerset Maugham

data.quote: While I cannot be regarded as a pillar  I must be regarded as a buttress of the church  because I support it from outside.
data.author: Lord Melbourne

data.quote: Atheism is rather in the lip than in the heart of Man.

data.quote: There's no reason to bring religion into it. I think we ought to have as great a regard for religion as we can  so as to keep it out of as many things as possible.

data.quote: Christianity might be a good thing if anyone ever tried it.

data.quote: B.I.B.L.E. = Basic Instructions Before Leaving Earth.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: If I could only see one miracle  just one miracle. Like a burning bush  or the seas part  or my uncle Sasha pick up a check.
data.author: Woody Allen

data.quote: If there's a God  why are there such things as famine and The Jerry Springer Show.
data.author: Wendy Morgan

data.quote: The first Sunday I sang in the church choir  two hundred people changed their religion.
data.author: Fred Allen

data.quote: I don't fly on account of my religion. I'm a devout coward.
data.author: Henny Youngman

data.quote: If you can't be kind  at least be vague.
data.author: David Powers

data.quote: God created man and then woman  but the atheist created himself.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: What if the meek inherited the Earth and we had to defend ourselves from Martians?
data.author: Robert Orben

data.quote: Jesus was born on a bank holiday and died on a bank holiday. We can therefore assume that when he returns again it will also be on a bank holiday.
data.author: P. G. Johnson

data.quote: As the little boy said to the Sunday School teacher after being told the reason we are on Earth is to help others: "Then what are the others here for?"
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: God is not a cosmic bellboy for whom we can press a button to get things.
data.author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

data.quote: It ain't those parts of the Bible that I can't understand that bother me  it's the parts that I do understand.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: I didn't want to pray to God 'cause I didn't want him to know where I was.
data.author: Marsha Dobb

data.quote: Conscience gets a lot of credit that belongs to cold feet.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: A New England conscience doesn't keep you from doing anything  it just keeps you from enjoying it.
data.author: Morris Mandel

data.quote: Conscience: That which makes a boy tell his mother before his sister does.
data.author: Laurence J. Peter

data.quote: His clear conscience is a result of a poor memory.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Conscience is the inner voice that warns us somebody may be looking.
data.author: H. L. Mencken

data.quote: The world's shortest sermon: "When in doubt... don't!"
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: A Puritan is a person who lives in the fear that someone  somewhere  may be having a good time.
data.author: H. L. Mencken

data.quote: My wife converted me to religion. I never believed in hell until I married her.
data.author: Hal Roach

data.quote: The service we render others is really the rent we pay for our room on Earth.
data.author: Wilfred Grenfell

data.quote: Coincidence is God's way of performing miracles anonymously.
data.author: Sophy Burnham

data.quote: I don't go to church. Kneeling bags my nylons.
data.author: Jan Sterling

data.quote: I don't see why religion and science can't get along. What's wrong with counting our blessings with a computer?
data.author: Robert Orben

data.quote: There was never law  or sect  or opinion did so much magnify goodness  as the Christian religion doth.
data.author: Sir Francis Bacon

data.quote: One religion is as true as another.
data.author: Henry Burton

data.quote: His religion at best is an anxious wish  - like that of Rebelais  a great Perhaps.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: Men will wrangle for religion  write for it  fight for it  die for it  anything but - live it.
data.author: Walter Colton

data.quote: Religion  if in heavenly truths attired  Needs only to be seen to be admired.
data.author: William Cowper

data.quote: If men are so wicked with religion  what would they be without it?
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: A good life is the only religion.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: My creed is this: Happiness is the only good. The place to be happy is here. The time to be happy is now. The way to be happy is to help make others so.
data.author: Charles J. Ingersoll

data.quote: To be of no Church is dangerous.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: Religion is the opium of the people.
data.author: Karl Marx

data.quote: Religion is nothing else but love to God and man.
data.author: William Penn

data.quote: He that hath no cross deserves no crown.
data.author: Francis Quarles

data.quote: The world is my country  all mankind are my brethren  and to do good is my religion.
data.author: Thomas Paine

data.quote: From listening comes wisdom and from speaking  repentance.
data.author: Old saying

data.quote: There are people who are very resourceful At being remorseful  And who apparently feel that the best way to make friends Is to do something terrible and then make amends.
data.author: Ogden Nash

data.quote: He's half absolv'd Who has confess'd.
data.author: Matthew Prior

data.quote: It is a very delicate job to forgive a man  without lowering him in his estimation  and yours too.
data.author: Josh Billings

data.quote: The sinning is the best part of repentance.
data.author: Arabic proverb

data.quote: Apology is only egotism wrong side out.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: Apologize  v: to lay the foundation for a future offence.
data.author: Ambrose Bierce

data.quote: Apology - a desperate habit  and one that is rarely cured.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: No sensible person ever made an apology.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Repentance is for little children.
data.author: Adolf Eichmann

data.quote: Repentance is but want of power to sin.
data.author: John Dryden

data.quote: Make it a rule of life never to regret and never look back. Regret is an appalling waste of energy  you can't build on it  it's good only for wallowing in.
data.author: Katherine Mansfield

data.quote: If I die  I forgive you: if I recover  we shall see.
data.author: Spanish proverb

data.quote: It is a good rule in life never to apologize. The right sort of people do not want apologies  and the wrong sort take a mean advantage of them.
data.author: P. G. Wodehouse

data.quote: God will pardon me. It's his business.
data.author: Heinrich Heine

data.quote: I suppose you've heard all those wicked stories about me. Well  I've lived my life as it came and I've done bloody marvels with a bad hand.
data.author: Libby Holman

data.quote: Republics are ungrateful.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: A monarchy is a merchantman which sails well  but will sometimes strike on a rock  and go to the bottom  a republic is a raft which will never sink  but then your feet are always in water.
data.author: Fisher Ames

data.quote: It is of great importance in a republic not only to guard against the oppression of its rulers  but to guard one part of society against the injustice of the other part.
data.author: Alexander Hamilton

data.quote: A republican government is slow to move  yet when once in motion  its momentum becomes irresistible.
data.author: Thomas Jefferson

data.quote: Republics are brought to their ends by luxury  monarchies by poverty.
data.author: Charles Montesquieu

data.quote: When I did well  I heard it never  When I did ill  I heard it ever.
data.author: Old English Rhyme

data.quote: The purest treasure mortal times afford Is spotless reputation  that away  Men are but gilded loam or painted clay.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Associate with men of good quality  if you esteem your own reputation  for it is better to be alone than in bad company.
data.author: George Washington

data.quote: Welcome death  quoth the rat  when the trap fell.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: A wise man cares not for what he cannot have.
data.author: George Edward Herbert

data.quote: That's best Which God sends. 'Twas His will: it is mine.
data.author: Owen Meredith

data.quote: Job feels the rod  Yet blesses God.
data.author: New England Primer

data.quote: I will sit down now  but the time will come when you will hear me.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli

data.quote: I am in earnest - I will not equivocate - I will not excuse - I will not retreat a single inch and I will be beard.
data.author: William Lloyd Garrison

data.quote: I propose to fight it out on this line if it takes all Summer.
data.author: Ulysses S. Grant

data.quote: Tell your master that if there were as many devils at Worms as tiles on its roofs  I would enter.
data.author: Martin Luther

data.quote: Never tell your resolution beforehand.
data.author: John Selden

data.quote: He that can take rest is greater than he that can take cities.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: On the seventh day God ended his work which he had made  and he rested on the seventh day.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Come unto me  all ye that labor and are heavy laden  and I will give you rest.
data.author: Matthew

data.quote: They have sown the wind  and they shall reap the whirlwind.
data.author: Ballou Hosea

data.quote: By their fruits ye shall know them.
data.author: Matthew

data.quote: Whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Earth to earth  ashes to ashes  dust to dust  in sure and certain hope of the resurrection.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: The only liberty an inferior man really cherishes is the liberty to quit work  stretch out in the sun  and scratch himself.
data.author: H. L. Mencken

data.quote: It is time I stepped aside for a less experienced and less able man.
data.author: Scott Elledge

data.quote: When a man retires and time is no longer a matter of urgent importance  his colleagues generally present him with a watch.
data.author: R. C. Sherriff

data.quote: The question isn't at what age I want to retire  it's at what income.
data.author: George Foreman

data.quote: Leisure time is when your wife can't find you
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Old age is when you know all the answers but nobody asks you the questions.
data.author: Laurence J. Peter

data.quote: I'm going to spend it all. . . why leave it to our errors?
data.author: Brian Morgan

data.quote: Retirement: Twice as much husband  half as much pay.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Constant togetherness is fine -  but only for Siamese twins.
data.author: Victoria Billings

data.quote: Retirement must be wonderful. I mean  you can suck in your stomach for only so long.
data.author: Burt Reynolds

data.quote: Our boss has been so successful he deserves to retire  so that he can spend more time . . . with his servants.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Since our boss will be retiring soon  it's been suggested that we give him a little momentum.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: I used to dread getting older because I thought I would not be able to do all the things I wanted to do  but now that I am older I find that I don't want to do them.
data.author: Lady Nancy Astor

data.quote: Cessation of work is not accompanied by cessation of expenses.
data.author: Cato the Elder

data.quote: You can't put off being young until you retire.
data.author: Philip Larkin

data.quote: The role of a retired person is no longer to possess one.
data.author: Simone de Beauvoir

data.quote: When men reach their sixties and retire  they go to pieces. Women just go right on cooking.
data.author: Gail Sheehy

data.quote: Retirement: statutory senility.
data.author: Emmett O'Donnell

data.quote: Two weeks is about the ideal length of time to retire.
data.author: Alex Comfort

data.quote: Absence of occupation is not rest  A mind quite vacant is a mind distress'd.
data.author: William Cowper

data.quote: Don't think of retiring from the world until the world will be sorry that you retire.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: Far from the madding crowd's ignoble strife.
data.author: Thomas Gray

data.quote: Few men of action have been able to make a graceful exit at the appropriate time.
data.author: Malcolm Muggeridge

data.quote: Dismiss the old horse in good time  lest he fail in the lists and the spectators laugh.
data.author: Horace

data.quote: I try to learn one new thing a week to balance the one thing I forget a week  but lately I forget three things a week.
data.author: Joseph Gies

data.quote: The mills of the gods grind slowly  but they grind exceedingly fine.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: The way of transgressors is hard.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: In taking revenge a man is but equal to his enemy  but in passing it over he is his superior.
data.author: Sir Francis Bacon

data.quote: Vengeance is a dish that should be eaten cold.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: Revenge is sweeter than life itself. So think fools.
data.author: Juvenal

data.quote: Vengeance is sweet.
data.author: William Painter

data.quote: Not to be provoked is best  but if moved  never correct till the fume is spent  for every stroke our fury strikes is sure to hit ourselves at last.
data.author: William Penn

data.quote: Revenge is an inhuman word.
data.author: Seneca

data.quote: A nation without the means of reform is without the means of survival.
data.author: Edmund Burke

data.quote: Every reform was once a private opinion  and when it shall be a private opinion again  it will solve the problem of the age.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: All reformers are bachelors.
data.author: George Moore

data.quote: Not actual suffering but the hope of better things incites people to revolt.
data.author: Eric Hoffer

data.quote: The most dangerous moment for a bad government is when it begins to reform.
data.author: Alexis de Tocqueville
